{"object id": "5388", "museum no.": "BM 118968", "publication": "Frame 2013", "text number": "11", "period": "ENB", "place of issue": "Ur city", "type and content": "Purchases", "day remark": "-", "month": "VI", "month remark": "-", "year": 8.0, "year remark": "-", "king": "Ššu", "king remark": "-", "paraphrase": "Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 3 minas and 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 7 shekels of silver, from B1. fields.paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 3 minas and 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 7 shekels of silver, from B1. The sold garden is the (inheritance) share (zittu) the seller divided (zâzu) with his uncle B2. It is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Ninurta Temple inside of Uruk. Its upper side borders on (the property of) the seller’s grandfather B3 and its upper front on (the property of) the seller’s uncle B2. Its lower side borders on the Ninurta Temple and its lower front on the street (sūqu). Neither cardinal directions nor measures are given for the sides of the plot. 11 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1 = Ahhēšāya/Hašdia/Šangû-Ninurta; B2 = Zibāya/Ērešu; B3 = Ērešu//Šangû-Ninurta; Scribe = Šulāya/Ibnāya

{"object id": "4425", "museum no.": "BM 30838", "publication": "Dar.", "text number": "318", "period": "Each", "place of issue": "Babylon city", "type and content": "Promissory notes ina muẖẖi", "day remark": "-", "month": "I", "month remark": "-", "year": 12.0, "year remark": "-", "king": "Dar", "king remark": "-", "paraphrase": "Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and barley. Repayment according to the measure of the head of the Egibi family.
B should pay the 1/2 mina of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, and the 38 kor of barley which are due from him, to A. Payment should be at the river (ina muhhi nāri) in Til-Gula, in one instalment and according to C’s measure, but it is not specified when it should take place. The place of delivery is further specified at the very end of the obverse, before the list of witnesses: at the lower embankment (ina šapliš kāri). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-bēlšunu/Arad-Marduk//Šangû-Ea; B=Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Nūr-Papsukkal; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)", "transliteration": "Transliteration available on Achemenet", "imported": "Kathleen Abraham (18/04/2016)", "publication name": "Dar. 318", "archive": "Egibi/Nūr-Sîn", "day (babylonian)": 16.0, "bibliography": "Reedition: Abraham 2004 108", "title": "BM 30838", "duplicate": NaN, "related objects": NaN, "julian date": "28/04/510 BCE", "julian date year": "510", "place of issue remark": NaN, "museum inventory no.": NaN, "page number": NaN, "join": NaN, "bibliography (free text)": NaN, "cdli no.": NaN, "nabucco no.": NaN, "other markings": NaN, "orientation": NaN, "other markings description": NaN, "cdli reference": NaN, "items and quantifiable data": NaN, "provenience": NaN, "akkadian keywords": NaN, "general keywords": NaN, "photo": NaN, "julian date remark": NaN, "provenience remark": NaN, "philological notes": NaN, "philological notes remark": NaN, "identifier": NaN, "babylonian date remark": NaN}
fields.paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and barley. Repayment according to the measure of the head of the Egibi family.
B should pay the 1/2 mina of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, and the 38 kor of barley which are due from him, to A. Payment should be at the river (ina muhhi nāri) in Til-Gula, in one instalment and according to C’s measure, but it is not specified when it should take place. The place of delivery is further specified at the very end of the obverse, before the list of witnesses: at the lower embankment (ina šapliš kāri). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-bēlšunu/Arad-Marduk//Šangû-Ea; B=Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Nūr-Papsukkal; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
